text:
Hi there!

We’re Happy Agencies (<http://www.happyagencies.com|www.happyagencies.com>), *experts in white-label services for HubSpot, development, marketing, design, and video editing.* Based in Argentina, we’re a cost-effective option, and this September and October, our CEO, Ariel Rajmaliuk, will be in the USA!

It’s a perfect chance to meet. *Ariel can help you close deals with your clients, offering expert solutions and support.* Let us be your right-hand team!

Let’s chat and make it happen :slightly_smiling_face:
when using the HubSpot cookie consent banner with scanning + blocking, do I just add scripts normally and then HubSpot will automatically block them until cookies are accepted or is there more to it?
part 2, can I still use google tag manager to load the scripts but trigger them on all page loads? (and HubSpot consent banner will handle it?)
is there a channel to paste over code I've made to get feedback from those that would like to offer feedback?

Hi John,

I hope you are well today.

Depending on what the code is for, it could be something for <#C2YHAHB6K|api> or <#C019VT42R8X|workflows> or <#CLJJXGTC0|local-development> but we don't have channels for every component of HubSpot here. Kinda just next-best as it's an open community.

Example, some code for content page headers sit better in <#CF540P856|seo>.

We do also have a dedicated <#CBA9UA4EN|javascript> channel for that.

If all else fails, <#C22PJ878V|random> I think! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi there
I'm looking for documentation or guides on how to use the nonce in Content-Security-Policy in the Domain security settings.
Any insights, links, or best practices would be greatly appreciated!
Thanks in advance!

Hey there!

I think <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/ssl-and-domain-security-in-HubSpot#content-security-policy|this is what you're looking for>, it also includes information on how to enable and handle nonce in the CSP. :slightly_smiling_face:
ok great, i might have over engineered something with chatgpt.  I'll post it in the workflow channel as its a custom code for a workflow step.

What is the recommended way to clean up old files in the design manager? I know I can click on a file and show dependents to see if it is in use. Is it as simple as doing that and if it isn’t being used I am good to delete it?
